Message.Msg: I can understand your dislike for Romney. HE PAID EVERY CENT HE OWED IN TAXES ( or Holder and the justice dept. would have brought charges against him) He gives MORE as a PERCENTAGE of his Large Earnings to charity THAN ( 95%) of you so called caring liberals! He doesn't smoke or drink. No scandals in his 40+ year marriage. Worked his way up the ladder in business and government with success through hard work. Now that he is rich, you liberals who went to a liberal colleges and learned nothing that trained you to make a living, are jealous and unhappy with your 60K job and think you should have more! You're just a bunch of dumb, jealous, hateful, idiots! Sorry my last comments were a little harsh, I guess I was watching a little to much MSNBC.

Topic.Title: The Romney / Ryan Campaign: Nebulous and Obscure by Design. Nondisclosure, hidden assets, blind trusts, offshore accounts, muddled double speak, flip-flops, vague agendas, shadowy cults, undefined plans, sealed tax records, confidential agreements, indecipherable financial records, four military service deferments, dark schemes, financial dodges, private equity funds....

Message.Msg: Do you think that in all the years Romney has filed his tax returns that the IRS would not have flagged him for illegalities if they existed? The "shelters and "schemes you referred to are legalities legislated as such by BOTH parties. You may want to learn of the number of members of Congress who are millionaires - and that many of them are Democrats, including the top few. Only recently was there legislation passed which forbid Congress to trade on "inside" information. Kevin Trudeau, 60 Minutes, and other media brouight to light the fact that reps like Nancy Pelosi had benefited on such inside information as a result of her access to "inside" information that a private citizen would not have been privy to. See if the the criticism you apply to the Romney campaign can be applied to the Obama team. From the other side of the mirror, it does apply. You need to take a step back and observe how your perception of reality is filotered by your political views. As an experiment to expand awareness of alternative ways of viewing events, I suggest you take a look at some of the articles in the editorial section of the Wall Street Journal, or you could read David Brooks found in the paper of your political persuasion, The NY Times. The high ideals and level of conversation pres Obama spoke of in years past has been violated by his own conduct and choice of languaging. Smoke and mirrors . Sorry. We all lose by his failures and fooling so many.

Topic.Title: And now, to ensure that no one dies of suspense, The Mystery Speaker at the Tampa Convention will be:

Message.Msg: Welcome back! It seems like most of the old gang has dispersed or assumed new identities (Federal Witness Protection Program?); what a pleasant surprise to see a constant re-appear among this swarm of variables. What did you think of Mitt's recent foreign policy initiatives in Great Britain and Israel? Next time I'm on the continent as a private citizen with no official standing, remind me to stop by for a chat with MI-5. Today the Boston Globe's leading proponent of All Things Right, Jeff Jacoby, ran a fluff piece on our Howard Roark stunt double entitled "Re-booting The Public Image" which attempts to explain Mitt's on-going 'ideological re-invention'. The Egalitarians of Euphemism must have pulled a few mental muscles coming up with that upgrade for 'shaking the Etch-A-Sketch'; it's so much more modern and technology-driven! It does make me curious about what platform he's got and what kind of operating system he's running, though. Speaking of curious, what made you jump back into BAC? ROTFLMAO at finding a deja vu mixed in with my vuja days.

Topic.Title: Democrat Keynote Speaker narrowly escapes arrest.

Message.Msg: You've never seen any of my posts defending or promoting Akin. Akin is an a--clown just like Nancy Pelosi who once said "My chair was getting crowded in," said Pelosi. "I swear this happened, never happened before, it never happened since." "My chair was getting crowded in and I couldn't figure out what it was, it was like this," she said. "And then I realized Susan B. Anthony, Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Lucretia Mott, Alice Paul, Sojourner Truth, you name it, they were all in that chair, they were," said Pelosi. "More than I named and I could hear them say: 'At last we have a seat at the table.' And then they were gone." This was not the only time Pelosi has told this story. On June 6 of this year she told it during an event celebrating her 25 years of political service. All these eggheads, both Democrats and Republicans need to be voted out of office and replaced with people who have standards that are not based on political considerations. Have a nice day.

Message.Msg: Banks switch teams Just looking at the securities and investment industry, Romney has received $11 million, compared with $4 million for Obama. Back in 2008, Obama received $16 million from the securities and investment industry, compared with $9 million for John McCain. Why has Wall Street switched its allegiance? “A lot of folks in the industry are worried that the second four years of an Obama administration will be tougher than the first four years,” said Edward Kramer, executive vice president of regulatory affairs at Wolters Kluwer Financial Services, a compliance-solutions provider. “There’s a sense that there is too much government involvement and that the government is restricting the ability for Wall Street to function.”

Topic.Title: WHO STILL THINKS THAT PRES O VOMIT CAN TURN THE ECONOMY AROUND??

Message.Msg: Better get used to him, you have another 4 years of the clown. Mitt doesn't have a chance. Btw, the banks have been screwing us for decades, especially since clinton deregulated the securities markets, opening the door for the mortgage bubble crash. Why people think republicans OR democrats can solve our problems is quite beyond me. Big business as usual, crapping on the little guy. Both parties need to go, career politicians should be banned. This whole poltics as jiff versus skippy is a farce and most of you believe that you need to take a blue pill or a red pill. Reps want to fight nonsense wars and dems want to waste your money on anything they can and raise your taxes. When is enough enough? The illusion of choice is what has us accelerating down the wrong path. And Ron Paul is not the answer either. No good options, this country is turning into a complete joke. The whole thing is an assault on the middle class, and those who rush to defend the banks are clearly braindead.

Message.Title: How long can the Federal Reserve hold this stock up?
Message.Msg: For such a vicious group of bankers, you would think the Federal Reserve would let go of the stock price of BAC and quit supporting it? Maybe they have bigger fish to catch. Like doing a LEH on SAN? The Federal Reserve never seems to be afraid of anyone or anything? So why the soft heart on BAC? The real Banking Crisis didn't come until 1933, 4 years after 1929. Geithner has already said in public speeches the goal of 2008 was to bring small banks and nonbanks, into the Federal Reserve Consolidated System. He should know he was Federal Reserve Bank of New York, CEO, and on the Federal Reserve Advisory Council(a level above the FOMC). Since Dudley is now head of both Federal Reserve Bank of New York and the BIS, are they more focused on taking down international banks, and leaving BAC alone for now?

Topic.Title: Chart says...

Message.Msg: Yeah, they are pricing in the "inevitable qe" which isn't inevitable since case schiller has reversed, and consumer sentiment sucks, which is a mixed signal. Most likely they are going to say something like, "we are ready to take action but want more time to see if it is necessary," which will #$%$ the markets off likely. Impossible to be sure, but that sure is the pattern. Forget these technicals and look at the lateral line, 8.2 is a concrete ceiling and a short side point of strength. Over and over and over. Silly people buy this thing over $8. Go to the track if you like gambling, BAC can be traded in one's sleep, a percent or two at a time on sizeable blocks. Love it. Staying away on thurs and early friday, can break either way, i am also seeing 7.8 or so as short term support.

NTWK $4.6...3M SHARE FLOAT....WILL REPORT MONSTER EARNINGS/GUIDANCE ON 9/4...EASY DOUBLE
Message.Msg: TARGET: $10+ AFTER EARNINGS 9/4/2012.......BREAKOUT LOOMING.......ABOUT TO CROSS GOLDEN CROSS AHEAD OF MASSIVE EARNINGS/GUIDANCE RECENT HUGE PREANNOUNCEMENT: NetSol Expects Fiscal Year 2013 Revenue of $46 Million to $49 Million and EPS s of $0.80 to $1.00 Company to Report Fiscal 2012 Financial Results on September 4 Fiscal 2013 Outlook for Netsol Technologies (NASDAQ: NTWK): "By many measures, fiscal 2012 was a year of great transformation for NetSol, evidenced by sequential quarters of revenue growth as well as earnings appreciation,"said Najeeb Ghauri, CEO of NetSol."Demand for our products has never been higher and I am fully confident in our teams' ability to lift NetSol to its next chapter of execution as fiscal 2013 gets under way." In July, NetSol previewed its financial results for the fiscal fourth quarter and year ended June 30, 2012, which underscored its strongest year ever. Based on preliminary estimates, NetSol said it anticipated total revenue for the fiscal fourth quarter of approximately $11.6 to $12.6 million. For the full fiscal year, the company anticipates total revenue in the range of $37 million to $38 million, translating to earnings per diluted share of of $0.30 to $0.40. NetSol plans to report its complete fiscal 2012 financial results on September 4, 2012. Looking forward and based on projects currently underway, combined with a steady base of recurring revenue, and robust demand for the core NFS solution, particularly in the APAC region, among other ongoing initiatives, NetSol anticipates growing total annual revenue in the range of approximately $46 million to $49 million for fiscal 2013. On a split-adjusted basis as discussed below, the company also expects earnings per diluted share of $0.80 to $1.00 for the year, translating into earnings per diluted share growth of more than 100%. "Throughout the past year we expanded our delivery footprint in the Asia pacific region, giving customers and prospects increased confidence, and as a direct result, have won a number of new contracts, several of which were signed late in the fourth quarter,"said Ghauri. "Adding to that, we also have a number of potential new customers who have already expressed interest in our Next Generation cloud-based leasing solution, which bodes well for us as we move to launch the product over the next few months." .........RADAR NTWK......IT WILL BREAKOUT MOMENTARILY......

Message.Msg: Gotta love the quants. Of course it is manipulation. GS, JPM, they have been #$%$ even their own clients and decide the price of stocks, not make bets. Moral hazard?! Ha!!! They sell short and then tell you too, and then when the market plummets they buy your positions back up and repeat the cycle. This big cap game is determing what their next manipulation is likely to be. Welcome to trading. Trade the chart and rely on mean regression and anticipate the news cycle. Market seems too high? Probably is. They tell you qe is coming... Sure, buddy. And watch gold and currencies and euro bond yields, they are leading the market, that and vix. They are expecting you to buy until disappointment happens, and unload their positions on you. hello! Just know it is a game and play it better. BAC doesn't hold 8 dollars, period. Any short above 8 is sure money unless the fed acts, and i wouldn't bet on that.

Message.Title: New Revelations from the Navy Seals who killed Bin Laden about Obama's Arrogance and Rudeness from the new book No Easy Day
Message.Msg: Though he praises the president for green-lighting the risky assault, Owen says the SEALS joked that Obama would take credit for their success. On his second night in Afghanistan waiting for final orders, sitting around a fire pit and joking about which Hollywood actors would play them in the bin Laden movie, one SEAL joked, “And we’ll get Obama reelected for sure. I can see him now, talking about how he killed bin Laden,” according to Owen. Owen writes: “We had seen it before when he took credit for the Captain Phillips rescue. Although we applauded the decision-making in this case, there was no doubt in anybody’s mind that he would take all the political credit for this too.” Later, while watching Obama’s speech announcing the raid, Owen writes: “None of us were huge fans of Obama. We respected him as the commander in chief of the military and for giving us the green light on the mission.” When one SEAL jokes again that they got Obama reelected, Owen asks, “Well, would you rather not have done this?” He writes: “We all knew the deal. We were tools in the toolbox, and when things go well they promote it. They inflate their roles. But we should have done it. It was the right call to make. Regardless of the politics that would come along with it, the end result was what we all wanted.” Later, when they meet Obama at the White House, Owen says he was reluctant to sign the American flag presented to the president because it would disclose his identity. So, at least one SEAL scribbled a random name on the flag. While going through the metal detector to meet the president, Owen’s pocketknife set off the alarm. After listening to Obama’s speech and enduring Biden’s “lame jokes that no one got (He seemed like a nice guy, but he reminded me of someone’s drunken uncle at Christmas dinner)" the president invited the team to return to his residence later for a beer. But Owen writes a few weeks later: “We never got the call to have a beer at the White House.” Joking with a fellow SEAL, “Hey, did you ever hear anything about that beer?” Walt cracks: “ You believed that #$%$ I bet you voted for change too, sucker.”
